data.title: Best in the area
data.text: Every time I go to the Twin Cities (business trip) I stay at Residence Inn. It´s too close to 494 and Highway 55 so it serves me very well. This time, maybe because I am a Marriot Rewards member, I was given a room with two bedrooms, at least 4 would sleep comfortably there but I was alone! No noise invading the windows. Everything one needs for some days is there: cutlery, dishes, fridge, oven, etc. Soap and shampoo are Paul Mitchell, shower is very good and easy to adjust. Bed is so comfortable I feel like home. Breakfast has fruit, yogurt, cereal, milk and eggs for those not used to usual American breakfast. Add this to the smiling and corteous service... That´s why I´ll always come back. Congrats.

data.title: Excellent stay for Ryder Cup
data.text: My friend and I stayed here for the Ryder Cup.  This is an excellent hotel.  The room are clean and maintained well.  It is quiet with good parking.  Several restaurant and grocery stores are close by.  It is close to the 494 so very convenient for us.  It is not close to the airport but no further than Shakopee.  I highly recommend staying here.

data.title: Excellent RI
data.text: I am a Marriott Platinum level and try to stay at RI's whenever there is one in a place I am working.  This is one of the better ones (and I haven't been in a bad one yet). The staff was outstandingly professional and sincerely helpful.  I felt they really wanted my stay to go as perfectly as possible.  The breakfast was probably one of the best at any RI.  Fresh, hot, always replenished and a changing variety.  Four very enjoyable days at a quiet, clean and comfortable hotel.  After a long day at work, it was like coming home.  You won't go wrong if you stay here.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear HJK13,

Thank you so much for being a Marriott Rewards Platinum Member. We appreciate your loyalty and hold your review in high regards as we know that you have, at the very minimum, spent hundreds of nights in Marriott hotels. We realize that you are an expert on hotels and are even more flattered by your comments. Thank you for taking the time to write this review and to compliment our staff.  We appreciate the kind words and hope that we will get a chance to welcome you back soon.

Thanks again,

Carolyn Murphy
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great food nice staff still not value for money for long term
data.text:
Best breakfast and socials i have had in all residence inns and hyatt houses.  They change a few breakfast items every day.  Like fruits bakery and a hot item.  A very refreshing change for long term customers.  Something which i always felt Long stay hotels should have. Additionally they always had alternative  for vegetarians. 
Staff is very helpful, pleasing and responds quickly. I had to check in earlier and they helped me happily.
Good location accessible by walk to multiple restaurants and cafes.    
A little over priced for a residence inn and rooms.  My room had a very distinct damp smell. I thought probably because the room was closed combined with their eco friendly AC UNIT.  i left the windows open but it did not work. I complained and they immediately sent a person even though it was after hours.  
The person said there was water clogging in HVAC and cleaned it.  But it still had that smell.  That was on ground floor.  Next time i stayed in third floor it had the same smell but a little less than ground floor room.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Fangypan,

Thank you so much for reviewing our property on TripAdvisor. I am so glad that you appreciated our complimentary breakfast. We did recently add some additional items, which included some fresher and upgraded offerings. We are glad that they were well-received. We are also glad that you found our staff to very helpful and responsive, but we are sorry to hear that you experienced an HVAC issue and that it elevated the dampness of your room. Typically, our rooms are not damp; although with the intense humidity of the summer, moisture levels may be slightly elevated. We apologize if that negatively impacted your stay.

We thank you again for taking the time to review our property and hoe to welcome you back soon.

Sincerely,

Carolyn Murphy
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Vacation stop
data.text: We are regulars with Marriott,  this hotel did not disappoint.  Room was ready early and staff was super.  Close to a health care complex. Sunday morning breakfast was excellent and free. Very quiet and very clean, thanks Marriott

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Doug,

Thank you for being loyal Marriott guests and for taking the time to right a review about our property. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and appreciate that you found our hotel to very clean as we pride ourselves on that. We are also glad that you enjoyed our breakfast, which we recently upgraded.

Thank you again for your review!  We hope that you come visit us again soon!

Sincerely,

Carolyn Murphy
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Large freezer great for overnight stay taking fish home
data.text: We stayed on last day of fishing trip before flying home.  Nice hotel -- very clean rooms with full kitchen and large refrigerator and freezer which was great for keeping fish frozen.   A nice sitting area in each room made it comfortable for couples to sit and talk.  Many choices of restaurant nearby and large shopping mall only about 10 minutes away too.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! We are so glad that you enjoyed your room and its amenities. We are also happy that you appreciated the cleanliness of the hotel as our housekeeping team works very hard and takes a lot of pride to ensure that everything is immaculate.

We hope that you enjoyed your MN fishing trip! it sounds like it was a successful one. Our team will be happy to welcome you back next fishing season! 

Warm regards,

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great stay!
data.text: This was a weekend stay for my family to enjoy stand up paddleboarding and boating on lake Minnetonka. The hotel was perfect for our family of 3 plus a small dog. The hotel was very pet-friendly and having a kitchenette allowed us to prepare our own food. The room was clean, spacious, quiet; kitchen adequate except for a non-working coffee maker. The free breakfast was good. We thoroughly enjoyed the saline/saltwater pool that was just the right temperature. We requested late check-out and got it. Overall, an enjoyable stay!

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your hotel experience on TripAdvisor. We are so glad that you enjoyed your weekend stay and many of the services and amenities at the hotel. We hope you had fun on Lake Minnetonka and you will stay with us again during your next lake trip. 

I apologize for the non-working coffeemaker in your room. I hope we were able to change it out for you right away. If there is ever anything not perfect during your stay, please do not hesitate to tell anyone on our team; we will be happy to correct it right away.

Again, thank you for your review! We do appreciate it!

Sincerely,

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice hotel
data.text: A newer hotel where the staff were very pleasant. The rooms are nice with a small kitchenette. It is close to the major highways. Don't miss out on the weekly happy hours where they serve food and adult beverages as well as the complementary breakfast. I will definitely stay here again when traveling for work.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Stas' K,

Thank you for your positive review! We are so happy that you enjoyed the hotel and were able to partake in both our complimentary breakfast and social hour offerings. Thank you also for complimenting the staff and for considering us again the next time work brings you into town. We can't wait to welcome you back!

Warm Reagrds,

Carolyn Murphy
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Love it!!
data.text: Staff is always awesome, welcoming and friendly. We have stayed multiple times at this location and our room is always clean and quiet.  Hot breakfast is always tasty and varied~including fresh fruit.  The location is close to the highway, easy to get on and off and maneuver to anywhere in Mpls/St. Paul area we are going.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear RockinRainboots,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor and for your acknowledgement of our hotel staff! 

I am glad that you enjoyed our breakfast. We recently made many upgrades to our offerings and are in the process of making a few more enhancements. It is so nice to hear great feedback.

We thank you for being a loyal guest and look forward to welcoming you back the next time you are in town!

Warm regards,

Carolyn Murphy
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Weekend Stay
data.text: Weekend rates are excellent for a very clean, spacious, room with full kitchen.  Very good breakfast with real food, nice pool.  Convenient parking, nearby restaurants, helpful staff.  Temperature controls are top-notch and responsive.  Overall, this is an excellent stay and in-line with what you would expect from a Marriott Residence Inn.  Highly recommended!

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Brian H,

We appreciate you taking the time to write about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so glad that you had an excellent stay and enjoyed our services and amenities, including our complimentary breakfast and indoor pool. Thank you for highly recommending us. Please come back and see us again soon!

Warm regards,

Carolyn Murphy
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Property With One Exception
data.text:
Overall a very nice property, with one main exception.  

Pro's:
-Newer and seems to be kept clean
-Nice rooms
-Quality breakfast: better than most Residence Inns
-Nice grounds

Con:
-The Gym is disgusting.  The machines don't look like they've ever been cleaned, and there isn't sanitizing wipes for people to use before and after using the machines.  This is very unusual.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear DenverCO303,

Thank you so much for your review! I am so glad that you enjoyed our hotel and made special note of our breakfast. We have recently made some upgrades to it and will continue to enhance it. Thank you for taking note of how clean the hotel was. We make that a top priority at the hotel. This is why I am very sorry about the condition of fitness room. We have followed up on the situation to ensure that the fitness center is always in top condition as well ensuring that sanitizing wipes are always available. We appreciate your feedback as it helps up improve. We hope to welcome you back the next time you are in town.

Sincerely,

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing hospitality
data.text: My husband and I were very impressed with the beautiful gardens greeting us, the warm, friendly front desk staff, and the immaculate rooms!  It was very quiet, and located very close to my husband's medical appointment. Beautiful walking paths right out the front door. The woman at breakfast impressed us because she was continually taking care to provide fresh, hot entrees, and constantly stirring and keeping the area immaculate.  We would definitely return to this superb hotel.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear 704regina1954,

Thank you so much for your glowing review! We are so glad that you enjoyed the gardens and breakfast at the hotel. Thank you also for recognizing our front desk and breakfast staff. I have shared your kind comments with them, which they appreciate. We hope to see you back soon!

Sincerely,

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great stay with two exceptions!
data.text: Really enjoyed every part of our stay with two exceptions.  The check-in process was fast, staff was friendly.  Our room was wonderful, comfortable bed, great shower and lots of comfortable easy chairs and sofa.  Now to the things that needed attention:  AC and breakfast.  The AC thermostat was located by the entry door and the vents were above the bed, so if you set the thermostat at 74, it would be about 65 in bed.  Not an easy fix for this issue.  The breakfast fix is an easy one.  Breakfast begins at 7 am, which is too late for any day.  There were several people that were waiting to have breakfast and had to wait for the doors to open.  To top it off, they didn't open the doors until a few minutes after 7. Might sound picky, but if you are in town for a swim meet where your grandson swims at 7:30, it doesn't give you much time to have breakfast and get to the meet.  Breakfast should never begin later than 6:30.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Lakefantoo,

Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience at our hotel on TripAdvsior! I am glad that you enjoyed the many features in our rooms as well as our friendly staff. I apologize that our breakfast was not open early enough for you to enjoy it and be on time for your grandson's swim meet. We do have later breakfast hours on the weekends as many guests are more leisurely; however, we are looking into expanding hours or at least having a few offerings available a little earlier. I also apologize for the HVAC issues you experienced as well. That is valuable feedback as not all of our rooms are set up that way, but we can look into the ones that area and ensure that we can come up with a remedy.

Thank you again for your review. We truly appreciate the feedback.

Sincerely,

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Family stay
data.text:
We were welcomed by Fuz at the front desk.  He provided detailed information about the hotel, room, area and dining.  

The room was nice and clean.  It had everything we needed for our family to rest and relax.  The breakfast was great with a variety of options!

Thank you Marriott for another great stay!

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Thank you so much for your kind review and in particular, recognizing one of team members. I love sharing reviews with team members who have been mentioned by name in reviews. We appreciate our guests that take the time to do this! We made sure to recognize Fuzz in one of our morning meetings and gave him high-fives.

Thanks again for your wonderful review!

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice Rooms, Ok breakfast, slightly overpriced
data.text:
- stayed here for a very short duration
- excellent room with all necessary amenities (kitchen, utensils, iron, ironing board, coffee maker)
- there were no water bottles in the room, which was an inconvenience for someone arriving late night and needs to get to business early  morning
- breakfast was mediocre

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvsior! I am glad that you enjoyed the hotel during your short stay. I appreciate your feedback regarding water bottles. Although we sell water in the lobby market, I understand that having water bottles in the room would be very convenient. We will definitely look into providing in-room water. Thank you also for your feedback regarding breakfast. Since your last stay, Residence Inn has revamped their breakfast and many of the offerings with the theme being fresher and more high quality ingredients. I hope you will be able to enjoy this the next time you are at a Residence Inn.

We hope to see you again the next time you are in Plymouth!

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good room, somewhat fair pricing
data.text: The fireplace suite was exactly what my wife & I needed while in Minneapolis for a concert. The room was clean. The breakfast selection was great. We stayed there for a Sunday night concert, and got a good rate for Saturday night, but the Sunday night rate was $20.00 more for the same room. That was a disappointment.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Jonesfamily33,

We appreciate your review and are so glad that you were able to enjoy one of our executive fireplace suites when you last stayed with us. I do apologize for the rate fluctuation during your stay. I can understand that it is more confusing to our guests; however, it does enable us to offer rates that our lower than our standard rates on weekends and lower demand periods. On Saturdays, our rates typically are lower than they are Sunday through Thursday, which are the days we offer our standard rates.

If you would like to speak to me more about your experience or if I can answer any questions for you, please do not hesitate to contact me directly at the hotel.

Thank you again for your feedback!

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
763-367-3151
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Rooms were great
data.text:
Loved this hotel with a few exceptions...

The pool did not have a hot tub....bummer

The rooms were huge and awesome with a great kitchen and bathroom....however the bed was very small in such a large space I am not sure why they put in a queen and not a king.

Awesome filtered water station in the breakfast area...but often the trash cans were overflowing especially right at the elevators on the main floor.

Overall a great experience...we got a great price on Hotels.com which made it worth all the little things that were wrong

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Thank you for review and for your feedback! We are so glad that you loved the hotel and enjoyed our large suites. We also appreciate you bringing to our attention some of the items that could have improved your hotel experience. We do value all feedback as it give us the opportunity to ensure that we are delivering the best service and hotel experience to all of our guests.  

Thanks again for your review! We hope that you visit us again during your future travels to the Plymouth area.

Sincerely,

Carolyn Murphy
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice family stay
data.text: Newer residence in plymouth. We stayed here for a little family getaway. Nicely set up rooms with kitchens and living areas. Pool was good, but lacked a hot tub. Breakfast was nicely done with a good selection of choices including eggs, oatmeal and cereal.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear sdn123,

Thank you for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor! We appreciate your review and are so glad that you enjoyed your family getaway. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautiful rooms, great staff.
data.text: We had a company retreat including a party and next-day training here, and could not have asked for better staff at the hotel!  Every single person working there was very helpful, super nice, and just all around amazing to work with.  I would rate this as "excellent," except the bed seemed too hard,  and we both felt like it sank down in the very middle (kept rolling inward!). Neither of us had a good night's sleep, but just because of the bed.  The hotel itself was quiet (we were on the 3rd floor), and actually, as I was leaving in the morning I noted that the door had a slow-close hinge on it, and that's why we didn't hear doors banging like we do at other hotels...very appreciated. The suite had full size refrigerator and complete kitchen along with everything needed if you desired to cook your own meals. Also had a sitting area with tv that could swivel around to watch tv in bed.  Great shower and large makeup/sink area also. We did not go down to the pool area, but this hotel has a saltwater pool, not sure what the reason for that is. Breakfast was great and full...not just a continental breakfast but they had all the usuals - yogurt, make-your-own waffles with condiments, sausage, scrambled eggs and a lot more. Fresh and good.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Holmz, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor! We are so glad that you enjoyed your company retreat and that our team was able to help make it a success. Thank you also for your feedback regarding your bed. We will be going through a renovation process shortly and most of our furniture items will be replaced in the next few months. 

I also wanted to answer your question regarding why we have a salt water pool… Chlorinating with salt through electrolysis gives us the ability to sanitize the pool at the same level a traditional pool does, but without using toxic chemicals. Salt water chlorination also produces less chloramines, which compromise air quality in an indoor pool setting. Chloramines can be very irritating to people, especially those with chlorine sensitivities. Most guests find that our pool is less harsh than traditionally chlorinated pools and that they do not experience red, irritated eyes and skin after swimming. We hope you have the opportunity to utilize the pool the next time you stay with us, and you can tell us what you think.

We look forward to welcoming you back on your next retreat! Thank you again for your review!

Sincerely,

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Sure has gone down hill fast!
data.text: We used to love going to this hotel but not sure what has happened.  Garbage not emptied outside and overflowing and the swimming pool area was a disaster.  Towels everywhere laying on the ground. The sheet for the sofa bed had a big pee stain on it in our room.(was in the "fresh" bag too. :(  Pipes made VERY loud noise every time someone showered above or below us and at midnight it wasn't fun listening to that. Internet/WiFi wasn't working either and until I complained then it got fixed. We also had the neighbors from hell fighting and yelling and then us being woken up with their "making up"  SMH.. not sure if we will be returning anytime soon.

owner_response.author: CarolynMurphy, General Manager at Residence Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Stacie, 

Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear about your recent stay and would like to assure you that what you experienced was not typical. Most of our guests find our hotel very clean and peaceful. I am committed to ensuring that each of our guests have an excellent experience at our hotel and would appreciate it if you would contact me directly at the hotel, so I can learn more about your experience and express my sincerest apologies personally.

Thank you,

Carolyn Murphy -General Manager
cmurphy@csmcorp.net
763-367-3151
owner_response.title: Owner Response
